title-group.article-title: The Potential of Applying Judeo-Christian Ethics to Tax Policy in Foreign Countries

permissions.copyright-statement: Â© 2008 Board of Trustees of the University of Illinois

abstract.p: This article extends the author s previous domestic analysis of tax policy and education finance under the moral principles of Judeo-Christian ethics to the international arena, beginning with an examination of the English-speaking OECD countries, which are the most economically and culturally similar to the United States. Although the tax and education finance of these five countries are closer to meeting Judeo-Christian moral principles than the United States, based on sources providing a macro-only analysis, this article concludes that none of these countries meet the moral requirement that tax burdens be allocated in a moderately progressive fashion, and that the tax and education finance policies of all of these countries appear to be moving further away from Judeo-Christian values.
